description:
'''Fun''' (stylized as '''fun.''') is an American [[pop rock]] band based in [[New York City]]. The band consists of [[Andrew Dost]] (of [[Anathallo]]) and [[Nate Ruess]] (of [[the Format]]), and formerly [[Jack Antonoff]] (of [[Bleachers (band)|Bleachers]]).

Fun formed in 2008, and their debut studio album, ''[[Aim and Ignite]]'', was released in 2009 to moderate commercial success. The band rose to prominence with the release of their second album, ''[[Some Nights (album)|Some Nights]]'', in 2012. The album peaked at number three on the U.S. [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart, and topped [[Billboard charts|''Billboard'']]'s [[Top Alternative Albums]] and [[Top Rock Albums]] charts. It spawned their biggest hit singles to date: "[[We Are Young]]" featuring [[Janelle Mon√°e]], "[[Some Nights (song)|Some Nights]]" and "[[Carry On (Fun song)|Carry On]]", all of which reached the top 20 on the U.S. [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] with "We Are Young" peaking at number one. At the [[55th Annual Grammy Awards]], they won the award for [[Grammy Award for Song of the Year|Song of the Year]] for their song "[[We Are Young]]"; they also won the award for [[Grammy Award for Best New Artist|Best New Artist]].
